study_plan_entry.title: Electronic properties of solids and superconductivity

free_text.Learning outcomes: To introduce students to important notions and techniques used in studies of electronic [br/]structure and transport propertiesof solids, and more specifically, of correlated electron [br/]materials, con-ventional and high-Tc superconductors.[br/]
free_text.Content: Review of basic concepts. Bands, Fermi surface, density of states. The Fermi liquid. Quasiparti-cles. Strongly correlated systems. [br/]Examples. Spectroscopic techniques : photoemission, x-ray absorption, elastic and inelastic x-ray[br/]scattering (Magneto-)transport properties in normal metals and low dimensional correlated systems: (mag-neto-)resistivity, Hall effect, magnetic susceptibility, EPR, NMR, tunneling.[br/]Characteristic properties of superconductors: the London model; Ginzburg-Landau model. Re-sults of microscopic theory - the BCS model and extensions. High temperature superconductors and related compounds; different approaches to high-Tc superconductivity.[br/]
free_text.Keywords: electronic structure, transport, insulators, metals, superconductors, correlated electron materials
free_text.Required prior knowledge: Basic condensed matter physics, thermodynamics, electrodynamics and quantum physics
